meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to three feet or 36 inches.
meanings.sent1: He measured the room in yairds to determine the carpet size.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used yairds of fabric to make the dress.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the yarn was a yairds long snake and pounced on it.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement stretched for yairds when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a visual aid to show the class the length of a yairds.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'yard', referring to a piece of enclosed ground adjoining or surrounding a house or other building.
meanings.sent1: The children played tag in the yairds behind the school.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors gathered in their yairds for a barbecue.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a cozy nest in the yairds of the backyard tree.
meanings.sent4: The laughter from the party echoed through the yairds.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed beautifully in the yairds of the garden.
